questions.question: What is the chemical formula for the compound synthesized by slow diffusion under an argon atmosphere involving Fe(BF4)2·6 H2O, pyrimidine, and K[Ag(CN)2]?
questions.answer: C8H8N6Ag2O2Fe

questions.question: What are the critical temperatures for the cooling and warming modes (Tdown_c and Tup_c) for 1 Ag during the spin-crossover transition?
questions.answer: 215 and 223 K for 1 Ag respectively

questions.question: What structural change occurs in the coordination polymers 1 Au and 1 Ag upon dehydration?
questions.answer: They transform from three interpenetrated networks into a single three-dimensional net

questions.question: What is the effect of temperature on the spin-crossover properties of [Fe(pdm)(H2O){Ag(CN)2}2]·H2O?
questions.answer: Temperature variation induces a reversible transformation between three interpenetrated 3D networks and a single 3D network, altering the spin-crossover switching properties.

questions.question: How does the spin-crossover behavior of 2 Ag compare to that of 1 Ag?
questions.answer: 2 Ag has a wider hysteresis loop than 1 Ag, indicating an increase in cooperativity due to stronger coordination bonds in a more rigid framework.

questions.question: Is the spin-crossover transition in 2 Au observed within the same temperature range as in 2 Ag?
questions.answer: No, 2 Au does not undergo a spin transition in the whole temperature range, unlike 2 Ag.

questions.question: True or False: The crystalline-state ligand substitution involving coordination/uncoordination of gaseous water and pmd in 1 Au and 1 Ag is irreversible.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or False: The thermal hysteresis observed in the spin-crossover transition of 1 Ag and 1 Au is indicative of a first-order transition.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: True or False: The spin-crossover transition in 1 Ag and 1 Au is accompanied by a color change from pale yellow to deep red.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What happens to the spin-crossover behavior of 1 Ag and 1 Au when exposed to an atmosphere of H2O?
questions.answer: Exposure to H2O vapor induces the inverse reaction at the Fe(2) sites, regenerating the three independent 3D networks.

questions.question: What is the role of the pmd ligand in the structural transformation of 1 Ag and 1 Au upon dehydration?
questions.answer: The pmd ligand bridges directly the Fe(1) and Fe(2) atoms, defining a system of infinite chains and leading to significant structural changes.

questions.question: True or False: The spin-crossover transition in 2 Ag is characterized by a decrease in the ligand-field strength at the Fe(1) site.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of 1 Ag involves the use of an H-shaped vessel for slow diffusion.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the significance of the cooperative combination of molecular events in the coordination polymers 1 Au and 1 Ag?
questions.answer: It is of fundamental significance for the generation of new switchable, multi-property materials.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of 1 Au involves the addition of a water solution of K[Au(CN)2] to an aqueous solution containing FeCl2 and pyrimidine.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the effect of dehydration on the crystallinity of 1 Ag and 1 Au?
questions.answer: Dehydration does not affect their crystallinity but alters their spin-crossover behavior significantly.

questions.question: True or False: The structural determination of 2 Au was carried out from a rigid-body Rietveld refinement of the hydrated model.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is the role of the [M(CN)2]- groups in the structure of 1 Ag and 1 Au?
questions.answer: The [M(CN)2]- groups link the Fe(1) and Fe(2) atoms, generating groups that connect to form rectangular motifs and define an infinite set of parallel layers.

questions.question: True or False: The spin-crossover transition in 1 Ag and 1 Au is not affected by the presence of hydrogen bonds in their structure.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the significance of the temperature range 345–399 K for 1 Ag and 323–382 K for 1 Au?
questions.answer: This temperature range is where complete and rapid loss of both ligated and nonbonded water molecules occurs simultaneously, leading to structural changes.
